   19: %%
   20: 
   21: -module(shell_docs_SUITE).
   22: -moduledoc false.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0, groups/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:    init_per_group/2, end_per_group/2, init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   26: 
   27: -export([render/1, links/1, normalize/1, render_prop/1,render_non_native/1, ansi/1, columns/1]).
   28: -export([render_function/1, render_type/1, render_callback/1, doctests/1]).
   29: 
   30: -export([render_all/1, update_render/0, update_render/1]).
   31: 
   32: -export([execute/3]).
   33: 
   34: -include_lib("kernel/include/eep48.hrl").
   35: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   36: 
   37: suite() ->
   38:     [{timetrap,{minutes,30}}].
   39: 
   40: all() ->
   41:     [ {group, render},
   42:       {group, prop},
   43:       {group, render_smoke},
   44:       ansi, columns,
   45:       doctests
   46:     ].
   47: 
   48: 
   49: groups() ->
   50:     [ {prop,[],[render_prop]},
   51:       {render, [], [render, render_non_native, links, normalize]},
   52:       {render_smoke, [], [render_function, render_type, render_callback]}
   53:     ].
   54: 
   55: %% Include a spec here in order to test that specs of undocumented functions
   56: %% is rendered correctly.
   57: -spec init_per_suite(Config1) -> Config2 when
   58:       Config1 :: list({atom(),term()}),
   59:       Config2 :: list({atom(),term()}).
   60: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   61:     {ok, ?MODULE} = c:c(?MODULE,[debug_info]),
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   65:     ok.
   66: 
   67: init_per_group(prop, Config) ->
   68:     ct_property_test:init_per_suite(Config);
   69: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: end_per_group(_GroupName, _Config) ->
   73:     ok.
   74: 
   75: init_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   76:     Env = [{App, Key, application:get_env(App, Key)}
   77:            || {App, Key} <- [{kernel, shell_docs_ansi},
   78:                              {stdlib, shell_docs_columns}]],
   79:     [{env, Env} | Config].
   80: 
   81: end_per_testcase(_TestCase, Config) ->
   82:     lists:foreach(
   83:       fun({App, Key, undefined}) ->
   84:               application:unset_env(App, Key);
   85:          ({App, Key, {ok, Val}}) ->
   86:               application:set_env(App, Key, Val)
   87:       end,
   88:       proplists:get_value(env, Config)).
   89: 
   90: %% We keep the docs of a couple of complex modules
   91: %% in the data_dir in order to compare then with the original
   92: %% when we fix bugs so that we don't break anything.
   93: %%
   94: %% This testcase is always run so that we do now forget to
   95: %% check that any bugfix does not break the current behaviour.
   96: %%
   97: %% If you do a bugfix that does not break this testcase when
   98: %% fixed you should include that module in the list of modules
   99: %% tested.
  100: %%
  101: %% Currently the modules are:
  102: -define(RENDER_MODULES, [sofs, re, file, erlang, user_drv, ?MODULE]).
  103: %% If you need to update the definition because this
  104: %% testcase fails, just run update_render/0,1.
  105: render(Config) ->
  106: 
  107:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  108: 
  109:     lists:foreach(
  110:       fun(Module) ->
  111:               maps:map(
  112:                 fun(FName, Current) ->
  113:                         case file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir,FName)) of
  114:                             {ok, Original} when Original =:= Current ->
  115:                                 ok;
  116:                             {ok, Original} ->
  117:                                 ct:log("Original: ~n~ts",[Original]),
  118:                                 ct:log("Current : ~n~ts",[Current]),
  119:                                 ct:fail(output_changed);
  120:                             {error, enoent} ->
  121:                                 %% All modules are not available on all
  122:                                 %% platforms. For instance socket is not
  123:                                 %% available on windows.
  124:                                 ok
  125:                         end
  126:                 end, render_module(Module, DataDir))
  127:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  128: 
  129: update_render() ->
  130:     update_render(
  131:       filename:join([os:getenv("ERL_TOP"),
  132:                      "lib", "stdlib", "test", "shell_docs_SUITE_data"])).
  133: update_render(DataDir) ->
  134:     lists:foreach(
  135:       fun(Module) ->
  136:               case code:get_doc(Module) of
  137:                   {ok, Docs} ->
  138:                       NewEntries =
  139:                           case beam_lib:chunks(find_path(Module),[abstract_code]) of
  140:                               {ok,{Module,[{abstract_code,{raw_abstract_v1,AST}}]}} ->
  141:                                   lists:map(fun({{Type, F, A}, Anno, Sig, #{} = Doc, Meta} = E) ->
  142: 
  143:                                                     case lists:search(
  144:                                                            fun({attribute, _, spec, {FA, _}}) when Type =:= function ->
  145:                                                                    FA =:= {F,A};
  146:                                                               ({attribute, _, What, {Name, _, Args}}) when What =:= Type; What =:= opaque andalso Type =:= type ->
  147:                                                                    {Name,length(Args)} =:= {F,A};
  148:                                                               (_) ->
  149:                                                                    false
  150:                                                            end, AST) of
  151:                                                         {value, Signature} ->
  152:                                                             {{Type, F, A}, Anno, Sig, Doc, Meta#{ specification => [Signature] }};
  153:                                                         _ -> throw({did_not_find, E})
  154:                                                     end;
  155:                                                (E) -> E
  156: 
  157:                                             end, Docs#docs_v1.docs);
  158:                               {ok,{shell_docs_SUITE,[{abstract_code,no_abstract_code}]}} ->
  159:                                   Docs#docs_v1.docs
  160:                           end,
  161: 
  162:                       ok = file:write_file(
  163:                              filename:join(DataDir, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".docs_v1"),
  164:                              io_lib:format("~w.",[Docs#docs_v1{ docs = NewEntries }]));
  165:                   {error, _} ->
  166:                       ok
  167:               end,
  168:               maps:map(
  169:                 fun(FName, Output) ->
  170:                         ok = file:write_file(filename:join(DataDir, FName), Output)
  171:                 end, render_module(Module, DataDir))
  172:       end, ?RENDER_MODULES).
  173: 
  174: find_path(Module) ->
  175:     maybe
  176:         preloaded ?= code:which(Module),
  177:         PreloadedPath = filename:join(code:lib_dir(erts),"ebin"),
  178:         filename:join(PreloadedPath, atom_to_list(Module) ++ ".beam")
  179:     else
  180:         Other -> Other
  181:     end.
  182: 
  183: handle_error({error,_}) ->
  184:   ok;
  185: handle_error(Doc) ->
  186:   unicode:characters_to_binary(Doc).
  187: 
  188: only_if_smp(Func) ->
  189:     only_if_smp(4, Func).
  190: only_if_smp(Schedulers, Func) ->
  191:     case erlang:system_info(schedulers_online) of
  192:       N when N < Schedulers -> {skip,"Too few schedulers online"};
  193:       _ -> Func()
  194:     end.
  195: 
  196: %%
  197: %% Render function
  198: %%
  199: %% This function tests that OTP code base can print its documentation
  200: %% in the shell. It is a time consuming operation that can take
  201: %% up-to 40 - 50 min if run in a single processor (1 scheduler config) machine.
  202: %%
  203: %% Skip the test case when running in a machine with not enough SMP.
  204: %%
  205: %% OBS. render_type/render_callback have shorter times and do not need
  206: %%      to be skipped, regardless of the number of available schedulers.
  207: %% 
  208: render_function(_Config) ->
  209:   only_if_smp(fun render_function_do/0).
  210: 
  211: render_function_do() ->
  212:     docsmap(
  213:       fun(Mod, D) ->
  214:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  215:               Exports = try Mod:module_info(exports)
  216:                         catch _:undef -> []
  217:                         end, %% nif file not available on this platform
  218:               pmap(
  219:                 fun(Config) ->
  220:                         try
  221:                             handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Config)),
  222:                             [try
  223:                                  handle_error(shell_docs:render(Mod, F, A, DHTML, Config))
  224:                              catch _E:R:ST ->
  225:                                      io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  226:                                                [Mod,F,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_doc(Mod,F,A)]),
  227:                                      erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  228:                              end || {F,A} <- Exports]
  229:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  230:                                 io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  231:                                 exit(R)
  232:                         end
  233:                 end, format_configurations())
  234:       end),
  235:     ok.
  236: 
  237: render_type(_Config) ->
  238:     docsmap(
  239:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  240:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  241:               pmap(
  242:                 fun(Config) ->
  243:                         try
  244:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Config)),
  245:                           [try
  246:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  247:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  248:                                io:format("Failed to render type ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  249:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_type_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  250:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  251:                            end || {{type,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  252:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  253:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  254:                             exit(R)
  255:                         end
  256:                 end, format_configurations())
  257:       end),
  258:   ok.
  259: 
  260: render_callback(_Config) ->
  261:     docsmap(
  262:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  263:               DHTML = markdown_to_shelldoc(D),
  264:               pmap(
  265:                 fun(Config) ->
  266:                         try
  267:                           handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Config)),
  268:                           [try
  269:                              handle_error(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, T, A, DHTML, Config))
  270:                            catch _E:R:ST ->
  271:                                io:format("Failed to render callback ~p:~p/~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  272:                                          [Mod,T,A,R,ST,shell_docs:get_callback_doc(Mod,T,A)]),
  273:                                erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  274:                            end || {{callback,T,A},_,_,_,_} <- Docs]
  275:                         catch throw:R:ST ->
  276:                             io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n",[Mod,R,ST]),
  277:                             exit(R)
  278:                         end
  279:                 end, format_configurations())
  280:       end),
  281:     ok.
  282: 
  283: docsmap(Fun) ->
  284:   F = fun F({Mod,_,_}) ->
  285:             F(Mod);
  286:           F(Mod) when is_list(Mod) ->
  287:             F(list_to_atom(Mod));
  288:           F(Mod) ->
  289:             case code:get_doc(Mod) of
  290:               {error, missing} ->
  291:                 ok;
  292:               {error, cover_compiled} ->
  293:                 ok;
  294:               {error, E} when E =:= eperm; E =:= eacces; E =:= eio ->
  295:                 %% This can happen in BSD's for some reason...
  296:                 ok;
  297:               {error, eisdir} ->
  298:                 %% Uhm?
  299:                 ok;
  300:               {ok, Docs} ->
  301:                 try
  302:                   _ = Fun(Mod, Docs),
  303:                   {ok, self(), Mod}
  304:                 catch E:R:ST ->
  305:                     io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p:~p~n",[Mod,E,R,ST]),
  306:                     erlang:raise(E,R,ST)
  307:                 end
  308:             end
  309:       end,
  310:   lists:foreach(F, code:all_available()),
  311:   ok.
  312: 
  313: 
  314: format_configurations() ->
  315:   [#{},
  316:    #{ ansi => false },
  317:    #{ ansi => true },
  318:    #{ columns => 5 },
  319:    #{ columns => 150 },
  320:    #{ encoding => unicode },
  321:    #{ encoding => latin1 }].
  322: 
  323: markdown_to_shelldoc(#docs_v1{format = Format}=Docs) ->
  324:     DefaultFormat = <<"text/markdown">>,
  325:     DFormat = binary_to_list(DefaultFormat),
  326:     case Format of
  327:         _ when Format =:= DefaultFormat orelse Format =:= DFormat ->
  328:             ModuleDoc = Docs#docs_v1.module_doc,
  329:             Doc = Docs#docs_v1.docs,
  330:             Docs#docs_v1{format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT,
  331:                          module_doc = process_moduledoc(ModuleDoc),
  332:                          docs = process_doc_attr(Doc)};
  333:         _  ->
  334:             Docs
  335:     end.
  336: 
  337: -spec process_moduledoc(Doc :: map() | none | hidden) -> map() | none | hidden.
  338: process_moduledoc(Doc) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  339:     Doc;
  340: process_moduledoc(Doc) when is_map(Doc) ->
  341:     maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc).
  342: 
  343: process_doc_attr(Doc) ->
  344:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Doc).
  345: 
  346: process_doc(Docs) when is_list(Docs) ->
  347:     lists:map(fun process_doc/1, Docs);
  348: process_doc({_At, _A, _S, Doc, _M}=Entry) when Doc =:= none orelse Doc =:= hidden ->
  349:     Entry;
  350: process_doc({Attributes, Anno, Signature, Doc, Metadata}) ->
  351:     Docs = maps:map(fun (_K, V) -> shell_docs_markdown:parse_md(V) end, Doc),
  352:     {Attributes, Anno, Signature, Docs, Metadata}.
  353: 
  354: 
  355: render_prop(Config) ->
  356: %    dbg:tracer(),dbg:p(all,c),dbg:tpl(shell_docs_prop,[]),
  357:     ct_property_test:quickcheck(
  358:       shell_docs_prop:prop_render(),Config).
  359: 
  360: links(_Config) ->
  361:     docsmap(
  362:       fun(Mod, #docs_v1{ module_doc = MDoc, docs = Docs, format = ?NATIVE_FORMAT }) ->
  363:               try
  364:                   [check_links(Mod, maps:get(<<"en">>,MDoc)) || MDoc =/= none, MDoc =/= hidden]
  365:               catch _E1:R1:ST1 ->
  366:                       io:format("Failed to render ~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  367:                                 [Mod,R1,ST1,MDoc]),
  368:                       erlang:raise(error,R1,ST1)
  369:               end,
  370:               [try
  371:                   check_links(Mod, D)
  372:                catch _E:R:ST ->
  373:                        io:format("Failed to render ~p:~p~n~p:~p~n~p~n",
  374:                                  [Mod,Kind,R,ST,D]),
  375:                        erlang:raise(error,R,ST)
  376:                end || {Kind,_Anno,_Sig,#{ <<"en">> := D },_MD} <- Docs];
  377:          (Mod, #docs_v1{ format = Fmt }) ->
  378:               io:format("Skipping ~p because format is ~ts~n",
  379:                         [Mod, Fmt])
  380:       end).
  381: 
  382: check_links(Mod, [{a,Attr,C}|T]) ->
  383:     case proplists:get_value(rel,Attr) of
  384:         <<"https://erlang.org/doc/link/seemfa">> ->
  385:             case string:lexemes(proplists:get_value(href, Attr),":#/") of
  386:                 [_App,TargetMod,Func,Arity] ->
  387:                     case code:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod)) of
  388:                         {ok, _ModDoc} ->
  389:                             case shell_docs:get_doc(b2a(TargetMod),
  390:                                                     b2a(Func),
  391:                                                     binary_to_integer(Arity)) of
  392:                                 [] -> throw({could_not_find,b2a(TargetMod),
  393:                                                 b2a(Func),
  394:                                                 binary_to_integer(Arity)});
  395:                                 _Else  -> ok
  396:                             end;
  397:                         _Else ->
  398:                             throw({could_not_find, TargetMod, Attr})
  399:                     end;
  400:                 _Callback ->
  401:                     ok
  402:             end;
  403:         _OtherlinkType ->
  404:             ok
  405:     end,
  406:     check_links(Mod, C),
  407:     check_links(Mod, T);
  408: check_links(Mod, [{_,_,C}|T]) ->
  409:     check_links(Mod, C),
  410:     check_links(Mod, T);
  411: check_links(Mod, [C|T]) when is_binary(C) ->
  412:     check_links(Mod, T);
  413: check_links(_, []) ->
  414:     ok.
  415: 
  416: normalize(_Config) ->
  417:     ?assertMatch(
  418:        [{p,[],[{em,[],[<<"a ">>,{code,[],[<<"b ">>]},<<"c">>]}]}],
  419:        shell_docs:normalize([{p,[],[{em,[],[<<" a ">>,{code,[],[<<" b  ">>]},<<" c">>]}]}])
  420:       ),
  421:     ?assertMatch(
  422:        [{'div',[],[<<"!">>]}],
  423:        shell_docs:normalize([{'div',[],[{code,[],[<<" ">>,{i,[],[<<" ">>]}]},<<" !">>]}])
  424:       ),
  425:     ok.
  426: 
  427: %% Special binary_to_atom that deals with <<"'and'">>
  428: b2a(Bin) ->
  429:     case erl_scan:string(binary_to_list(Bin)) of
  430:         {ok,[{atom,_,A}],_} -> A;
  431:         {ok,[{A,_}],_} -> A
  432:     end.
  433: 
  434: %% Test rendering of non-native modules
  435: render_non_native(_Config) ->
  436:     Docs = #docs_v1{
  437:         anno = erl_anno:new(13),
  438:         beam_language = not_erlang,
  439:         format = <<"text/asciidoc">>,
  440:         module_doc = #{<<"en">> => <<"This is\n\npure text">>},
  441:         docs = []
  442:     },
  443: 
  444:     <<"\n\tnot_an_erlang_module\n\n"
  445:       "    This is\n"
  446:       "    \n"
  447:       "    pure text\n">> =
  448:         unicode:characters_to_binary(
  449:           shell_docs:render(not_an_erlang_module, Docs, #{ ansi => false })),
  450: 
  451:     ok.
  452: 
  453: %% Testing functions
  454: render_all(Dir) ->
  455:     file:make_dir(Dir),
  456:     %% We load all possible application in order to be able to use
  457:     %% application:get_application to get the application a module
  458:     %% belongs to.
  459:     PossibleApplications =
  460:         lists:flatmap(
  461:           fun(P) ->
  462:                   filelib:wildcard(filename:join(P, "*.app"))
  463:           end, code:get_path()),
  464:     [application:load(list_to_atom(filename:basename(filename:rootname(App)))) ||
  465:         App <- PossibleApplications],
  466:     docsmap(fun(Mod, D) ->
  467:                     maps:map(
  468:                       fun(FName, Value) ->
  469:                               file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, FName), Value)
  470:                       end, render_module(Mod, D))
  471:             end).
  472: 
  473: render_module(Mod, #docs_v1{ docs = Docs } = D) ->
  474:     put({shell_docs, nospecs}, non_existing),
  475:     Opts = #{ ansi => true, columns => 80, encoding => unicode },
  476:     case application:get_application(Mod) of
  477:         {ok, App} ->
  478:             App;
  479:         _ ->
  480:             App = unknown
  481:     end,
  482:     SMod = atom_to_list(App) ++ "_" ++ atom_to_list(Mod),
  483:     Files =
  484:         #{
  485:           SMod ++ ".txt" =>
  486:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, D, Opts)),
  487:           SMod ++ "_type.txt" =>
  488:               unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, D, Opts)),
  489:           SMod ++ "_cb.txt" =>
  490:                     unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, D, Opts))
  491:          },
  492:     lists:foldl(
  493:       fun({_Type,_Anno,_Sig,none,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  494:               Acc;
  495:          ({{function,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  496:               FAName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_func.txt",
  497:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_func.txt",
  498:               FADocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts)),
  499:               FDocs = unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render(Mod, Name, D, Opts)),
  500:               case string:equal(FADocs,FDocs) of
  501:                   true -> 
  502:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs };
  503:                   false ->
  504:                       Acc#{ sanitize(FAName) => FADocs,
  505:                             sanitize(FName) => FDocs}
  506:               end;
  507:          ({{type,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  508:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_type.txt",
  509:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  510:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_type(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))};
  511:          ({{callback,Name,Arity},_Anno,_Sig,_Doc,_Meta}, Acc) ->
  512:               FName = SMod ++ "_"++atom_to_list(Name)++"_"++integer_to_list(Arity)++"_cb.txt",
  513:               Acc#{ sanitize(FName) =>
  514:                         unicode:characters_to_binary(shell_docs:render_callback(Mod, Name, Arity, D, Opts))}
  515:       end, Files, Docs);
  516: render_module(Mod, Datadir) ->
  517:     {ok, [Docs]} = file:consult(filename:join(Datadir, atom_to_list(Mod) ++ ".docs_v1")),
  518:     render_module(Mod, Docs).
  519: 
  520: sanitize(FName) ->
  521:     lists:foldl(
  522:       fun({Re,Replace}, Txt) ->
  523:               re:replace(Txt,Re,Replace,[global,{return,list}])
  524:       end, FName, [{"/","slash"},{":","colon"},
  525:                    {"\\*","star"},{"<","lt"},{">","gt"},{"=","eq"}]).
  526: 
  527: ansi(_Config) ->
  528:     {ok, Docs} = code:get_doc(?MODULE),
  529: 
  530:     HasESC =
  531:         fun(Config) ->
  532:                 Doc = shell_docs:render(?MODULE, Docs, Config),
  533:                 string:find(Doc, "\e") =/= nomatch
  534:         end,
  535: 
  536:     application:set_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, true),
  537:     ?assert(HasESC(#{})),
  538:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{ansi => false})),
  539:     ?assert(HasESC(#{ansi => true})),
  540: 
  541:     application:set_env(kernel, shell_docs_ansi, false),
  542:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{})),
  543:     ?assertNot(HasESC(#{ansi => false})),
  544:     ?assert(HasESC(#{ansi => true})),
  545: 
  546:     ok.
  547: 
  548: -doc """
  549: Doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc doc.
  550: """.
  551: columns(_Config) ->
  552:     {ok, Docs} = code:get_doc(?MODULE),
  553: 
  554:     MaxColumns =
  555:         fun(Config0) ->
  556:                 Config = maps:merge(#{ansi => false}, Config0),
  557:                 Doc = shell_docs:render(?MODULE, ?FUNCTION_NAME, Docs, Config),
  558:                 Lines = string:split(Doc, "\n", all),
  559:                 lists:max(lists:map(fun string:length/1, Lines))
  560:         end,
  561: 
  562:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, 30),
  563:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) =< 30),
  564:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{columns => 20}) =< 20),
  565: 
  566:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, not_an_integer),
  567:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  568: 
  569:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, 0),
  570:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  571: 
  572:     application:set_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns, -30),
  573:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  574: 
  575:     application:unset_env(stdlib, shell_docs_columns),
  576:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{}) > 30),
  577:     ?assert(MaxColumns(#{columns => 20}) =< 20),
  578: 
  579:     ok.
  580: 
  581: doctests(_Config) ->
  582:     shell_docs:test(shell_docs_test,
  583:                     [
  584:                      {function, module, 2}, erl_eval:add_binding('A', hello,
  585:                                                                  erl_eval:new_bindings())]),
  586:     ok.
  587: 
  588: %%
  589: %% Parallel map function.
  590: %%
  591: %% Parallel map function that discards the result of the function
  592: %% `F` applied to each of the items in `Ls`. It spawns as many
  593: %% processes as items there are in `Ls`. If the list is large,
  594: %% consider adding a set of working processes that round-robin on
  595: %% the job to do be done.
  596: %%
  597: %% - `F` is the function to perform
  598: %% - `Ls` the list of items to iterate on
  599: %%
  600: pmap(F, Ls) when is_function(F),
  601:                  is_list(Ls) ->
  602:   _ = lists:foreach(fun(Config) ->
  603:                         spawn_link(?MODULE, execute,[Config, F, self()])
  604:                    end, Ls),
  605:   ResponseCounter = length(Ls),
  606:   ok = sync(ResponseCounter),
  607:   ok.
  608: 
  609: execute(Item, F, Pid) ->
  610:   _ = F(Item),
  611:   Pid ! ok.
  612: 
  613: sync(0) ->
  614:   ok;
  615: sync(N) ->
  616:   receive
  617:     ok ->
  618:       sync(N-1)
  619:   end.
